However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Before we get to the best KitchenAid mixer Cyber Monday deals on the internet, a thought exercise: Do you ever think about what it must have been like to cook in the 1600s? One minute you'd be kneading a dough ball the size of your donkey by hand, and the next you’d be like, “Oh shoot, I forgot to collect the firewood!” There were no ovens, no pre-wrapped golden bricks of unsalted butter, and, most devastating, no KitchenAid mixers. Thankfully, those colorful countertop icons have become the workhorses (work-donkeys?) of our modern kitchens. With just the flick of a knob we can prep toasty morning buns, caramelized apple galettes, and dramatic meringue puddings in minutes.Since the industrial stand mixer’s invention in the 1910s, what the behemoth original has lost in size (about 75 quarts), it’s gained in versatility. The KitchenAid mixer we know and love comes with a flat edge beater to mix brownies or cream butter and sugar; a whisk, for whipping egg whites, frosting, and fresh cream; and a dough hook, which makes light work of kneading focaccia, pizza dough, and other yeast-based breads. And with the fleet of other nifty attachments— a slicer for shredding carrots, a food grinder for making sausages, and a flex edge beater that scrapes the bowl for you—the possibilities are truly endless.So are the Cyber Monday deals. Across the internet, the KitchenAid mixer is on sale at discounts of up to 25% off, making now—as in, right now!—the best time to buy one. Or, if you’re already on team stand mixer, cop a bunch of new attachments at a prices you probably won’t see again, at least until this time next year. (And if you’re looking for other great steals on kitchen appliances, look no further than our ultimate list of Cyber Monday kitchen deals.) Read on, and don’t forget to roll one out for our fore-cooks.Artisan Mini Series Stand MixersIf you have a small kitchen or regularly bake in small batches, the KitchenAid Artisan Mini is the stand mixer for you. It’s the lightest and smallest of the line but just as powerful as the brand’s classic stand mixer. Equipped with a 3.5-quart stainless steel mixing bowl, this mighty appliance can still mix up five dozen cookies in a single batch. You’ll appreciate its tilt-head design, which allows you to easily add ingredients to the bowl and then lock the head in place while mixing.KitchenAid Artisan Mini 3.5-Qt. Tilt-Head Stand Mixer$350 $300 at KitchenAid$400 $280 at WayfairClassic Series Stand MixersKitchenAid’s most popular mixers are part of the Classic Series. With a 4.5-quart capacity, they’re the perfect size for almost any recipe—from marshmallows to buttercream to kneaded bread—and can mix up to eight dozen cookies at a time. And like the Artisan Mini, this one is also made with a functional tilt-head design. Often referred to as the standard KitchenAid stand mixer, it’s a solid option for both beginners and professionals alike.KitchenAid Classic Series 4.5 Quart Tilt-Head Stand Mixer$300 $294 at TargetArtisan Series Stand MixersKitchenAid Artisan stand mixers are similar to the brand’s Classic Series stand mixers, but with a few upgrades, including a 5-quart capacity that can mix up to nine dozen cookies at once and a powerful 325-watt motor, as opposed to the Classic’s 250-watt motor. The artisan mixers also come in more colors (39 to be exact) and with different types of bowls. Choose between stainless steel, glass, or KitchenAid’s limited edition black ceramic bowl that looks kind of like a hand grenade.KitchenAid Artisan 5-qt. Stand Mixer$430 $412 at Target$430 $350 at KitchenAidKitchenAid Artisan Series 5-Qt. Limited Edition Stand Mixer with Ceramic Bowl$550 $450 at KitchenAidProfessional Series Stand MixersMeet the mixers with all the bells and whistles: the KitchenAid Professional Series. Unlike the brand’s other stand mixers, Professional Series mixers utilize a bowl-lift design instead of a tilt-head design and come with larger bowl capacities ranging from 5 quarts to 8 quarts. These mixers also have ultra-powerful motors, ranging from 525 watts in the Series 5 motors to 575 watts in the Series 6. You’ll find some of the best KitchenAid mixer Cyber Monday deals within this category, so if you’re looking for bargains, this is it.KitchenAid Professional 5-Qt. Stand Mixer$430 $294 at Target$500 $250 at Best BuyAlready have a stand mixer? Check out these Cyber Monday deals on KitchenAid attachments.KitchenAid Pasta Roller & Cutter SetHomemade pasta easily comes together with this three-piece set that includes an adjustable pasta roller and stainless steel cutters for fettuccine and spaghetti.KitchenAid 3-Piece Pasta Roller & Cutter Attachment Set$180 $160 at Amazon$200 $188 at TargetKitchenAid Grinder AttachmentGrind your own meat for sausages and burgers (just like a cook in the 1600’s, sorta) with the KitchenAid food grinder attachment, which comes with fine, medium, and coarse grinding plates.KitchenAid Grinder Attachment$100 $90 at AmazonKitchenAid Fresh Prep Slicer/Shredder AttachmentAn attachment that can handle dreaded prepping tasks, like slicing cucumbers, carrots, and cheese. Bonus: All of the blades are dishwasher safe.KitchenAid Fresh Prep Slicer/Shredder Attachment$65 $40 at AmazonDon’t have room for a stand mixer? The KitchenAid cordless hand mixer is on sale too.In search of the best KitchenAid hand mixer? Look no further. Our favorite hand mixer has all the power of a regular hand mixer without a cord—so you can use it sans outlet, in any area of your kitchen. It has seven high speeds for stirring, mixing, and whipping through (almost) any recipe and a built-in battery that lasts up to four uses before needing to be recharged. You’ll also love that the back of this mixer has a flat surface, which allows it to stand upright on its own.Photo by Isa Zapata, Food Styling by Cyd McDowell, Prop Styling by Paige HicksKitchenAid Cordless Hand Mixer$100 $70 at Amazon$100 $70 at Bed Bath & BeyondLooking for more KitchenAid products at discounted prices?KitchenAid Aluminized Steel Square Cake PanWhen it comes to baking, metal is better—specifically aluminized metal, which is naturally nonstick and conducts heat like a boss, so that your baked goods are evenly browned.KitchenAid Aluminized Steel Square Cake Pan$20 $12 at AmazonKitchenAid All Purpose ShearsEvery kitchen needs a sturdy pair of shears for snipping herbs, cutting bacon into bits, and opening food packaging. KitchenAid's are durable and come with a protective sheath. KitchenAid All Purpose Shears$11 $7 at AmazonKitchenAid Dish RackYou'll need it to hold all the new KitchenAid gear you just purchased. Made of rust-resistant stainless steel, this full-size dish rack comes with a removable drain board and flatware caddy.KitchenAid Full Size Dish Rack$73 $60 at AmazonKitchenAid Mini Food ChopperWith a 3.5-cup capacity, this brawny but small food processor is lightweight, compact, and perfect for everyday use. Its countertop friendly footprint means you’ll never need to put it away.KitchenAid Mini Food Chopper$55 $40 at Amazon$55 $47 at TargetKitchenAid Digital Kitchen ScaleWith a simple-to-read digital display and an 11-pound capacity, this kitchen scale can tackle (almost) any cooking task. And the sleek glass surface isn’t just pretty—it’s also easy to clean.KitchenAid Digital Kitchen Scale$30 at AmazonKitchenAid Silicone Can OpenerYou want to make pumpkin pancakes—and that can of pumpkin puree isn’t going to open itself.
